result.taxonomicnotes: Originally described as Rivulus sape (Lasso et al. 1992), due to a revision of the subfamily Rivulinae it was recently changed to Laimosemion after this was considered a valid genus and not a subgenus of Rivulus (Costa 2011).
result.rationale: This species has an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 8,820 km<sup>2</sup>. There is a continuing decline in the extent and quality of its habitat related to deforestation, fires and small farms. However, there is insufficient information on threats in order to count locations for this species. Therefore, it is assessed as Near Threatened.
result.geographicrange: This species is known from Guiana Shield and has only been collected in the Ichun River and its tributaries, that drain the upper Paragua River, in the Caroní River Basin, Bolívar state.
result.population: There are no data available to estimate the population size.
result.habitat: It occurs in marginal pools of small creeks with clear waters with sandy to muddy bottoms and abundant leaf litter. Water conditions are: temperature of 24°C, acidic (pH 4.8-5.2), high concentrations of dissolved oxygen (7.4 mg/l) and low conductivity (16 ms/cm) (Lasso-Alcalá et al. 2006).
result.threats: The main threat for this species is represented by the deforestation of tropical forests because of log extraction, fires and the settlement of farms (Oliveira-Miranda et al. 2010).
result.conservationmeasures: Around 65% of the population occurs within Natural Monument Cerro Ichum.
result.usetrade: It is unknown if this species is traded for ornamental purposes. Research is needed to establish this.
